title: Climate Change and Population Health: Environmental Epidemiology Module for Nursing Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mechanics and public health concepts
context.additional_context: Optimization of smartphone-based LMS learning environments utilizing practical case studies reflecting COVID-19 pandemic experiences.

learning_goals: Explain three or more major impacts of climate change on the health of vulnerable populations (e.g., elderly, chronic disease patients).
Apply methods to identify community health risk factors by analyzing environmental epidemiological data.
Present case-specific safety management strategies for medical personnel in climate crisis situations.
Engage in discussions and provide feedback on climate-health linkage issues with peer learners via an LMS platform.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
